text:
Four #flood warnings remain in place for Essex as of 1100, according to @EnvAgencyAnglia.

They're for River Roding (Loughton), River Stort (Harlow), Mardyke (North Stifford to Purfleet) and River Colne (Halstead to Lexden).

There are also 17 flood alerts https://t.co/hDHPrxgSpU https://t.co/SydeSGIHxV

urls.title: Flood warnings for Essex, England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

urls.title: Mining Landfills
urls.description: Strategic Metals: Will future supply be able to meet future demand? Landfills are commonly considered only in association with their negative aspects: long-term methane emissions, local pollution, ground water pollutio n, and limitations on urban development. The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development says 3 billion tons of trash a year will contribute to landfills worldwide by 2030, up from 1.6 billion in 2005. However, recent endeavors to reuse waste materials found in dumps suggest the

text: @guyshrubsole @RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot @DrKateSpencer @EnvAgency There is actually a report I’ve seen that discusses the mining of old landfills for profit from the methane, metals & plastics they contain. This could therefore be turned from a story of “who is to pay,” to “who will pay for the privilege of cleaning up this area.”
@RealJohnEvo @EnvAgency @CambsCC Wow! That's horrendous 😕 😢

@LiverpoolSUPCo @FormbyVillage @GreenSefton_ @RSPBEngland @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @seftoncouncil @LCRTourismAward @yoe2019lcr @ConservHalton @RegionofHalton My profile pic shows curlews in the field at the end of my close in Formby (Liverpool City Region). The field is now a Redrow Homes housing estate with 100 houses and no curlews.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Years ago I was employed as an environmental consultant to find toxic waste sites around Derry. A local factory had been paying farmers to take away and dispose of toxic waste as it was cheaper than paying a landfill. I did find some of the locations but likely there are others.
@ben_watt @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 Looks terrible Ben, really neglected. I wonder if @Feargal_Sharkey has seen it?

@kernowbeaver @sophiepavs @BeaverTrust @TonyJuniper @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith @EnvAgency Thank you, 
It’s actually starting to make sense how over time these differences have impacted our green lands 
Nature to me is like an expensive Lego set,
Yeah you can build it with a few pieces missing 
But it needs all the pieces to truely function and be complete,
